meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material worn around the waist to support clothing or hold weapons.
meanings.sent1: She tightened her belt before heading out for a walk.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy's belt had a shiny buckle.
meanings.sent3: The belt seemed to have a mind of its own, always loosening at the wrong time.
meanings.sent4: His belt of courage never failed him in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The belt creaked softly as he adjusted it around his waist.

meanings.definition: A continuous band of material used to transmit motion or power.
meanings.sent1: The conveyor belt moved the packages along swiftly.
meanings.sent2: The engine's timing belt needed replacement.
meanings.sent3: The belt of energy hummed with power, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acted as a driving belt, pushing her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The belt spun smoothly, transferring energy from one machine to another.

meanings.definition: A strip of land or water that is narrow in relation to its length.
meanings.sent1: The river snaked through the narrow belt of trees.
meanings.sent2: The hiking trail followed a scenic belt along the mountainside.
meanings.sent3: The belt of grass looked like a green ribbon from above.
meanings.sent4: The belt of fog obscured the view of the valley below.
meanings.sent5: The belt of sand shimmered under the hot sun.
